Comments: Arrived on SS Mount Temple. 25 Officers 996 OR
Traveled by Train
Short March. 15 Days in Merris Training
Bussed to Vlamertinghe -  then marched to Infantry Barracks.
84th Brigade HQ
In the trenches betwee Ypres-Comines canal and Hill 60
84th Brigade HQ
Rest day
84th Brigade HQ then back into the front line -  heavy shelling
Rest day
Rest day
Relieved 3rd Middlesex in trenches with waist deep water.
Replaced by 2nd Northuumberland Fusiliers
Relieved 2nd Northumberland Fusiliers in same trenches
Replaced by 4th Royal Fusiliers. 6 killed 28 wounded
Temporarily assigne to 5th Division
Relieved 1st Dorset.  Bus Farm Reserve Trenches
Relieved 2nd Cheshires.  Quiet time in trenches.
Replaced by York&Lancaster Regiment. Rest time.
Relieved 2nd Seaforth Highlanders. Few Casualties
Replaced by Royal Irish Fusiliers.
Rest day
Relieved 2nd Cheshires. In trenches
Replaced by 2nd Cheshires.  Rest days
Relieved 2nd Cheshires. In trenches
Repkaced by 7th Bolts and Derby.  Rest days
Crossed Paths with 2nd Suffolks. Mini Reunion
Enroute
Repositioning to East of Ypres
Relieved 2nd Cheshires. In trenches intermittent fighting
2nd Battle of Ypres Starts. First use of Gas.
Withdrawn from front lines.
Moved up to Support Canadians -  Germans had broken through the lines
In danger of being overrun -  all maps and documents destroyed.
400 Casualties in 10 days fighting.
Battle of Frezenberg. Intense fighting 400 casualties.  Ernest Missing
Only 27 men of 1st Suffolk remain.
Replacements Received. Total of 11 Officers and 286 OR. 1000 men lost in 6 weeks.
!st Suffolks combined with survivors to form composite Battalion of 84 Brigade
Removed from line to rest and train
Strength 20 Officers 597 Ors. Marching Back to the front.
Back in trenches -  mostly mining and sniping.
